channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: More deployments testing the president's use troops in states and cities
item.description: The Pentagon seeks to deploy the National Guard to more cities to quell what the president sees as lawlessness and riots.
item.content:encoded: The Pentagon seeks to deploy the National Guard to more cities to quell what the president sees as lawlessness and riots.
item.dc:creator: Luke Garrett

item.title: Gaza peace talks to start Monday in Egypt
item.description: President Trump's son-in-law, Jared Kushner, will be part of the talks after Hamas and Israel agreed to move forward with the first stage of the U.S. plan.
item.content:encoded: President Trump's son-in-law, Jared Kushner, will be part of the talks after Hamas and Israel agreed to move forward with the first stage of the U.S. plan.
item.dc:creator: Emily Feng

item.title: As Israel and Hamas inch toward a deal, humanitarian conditions in Gaza remain dire
item.description: NPR's Andrew Limbong speaks with UNICEF spokesperson James Elder in Gaza about what a potential peace deal could mean for humanitarian needs on the ground.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Andrew Limbong speaks with UNICEF spokesperson James Elder in Gaza about what a potential peace deal could mean for humanitarian needs on the ground.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Limbong

item.title: Pope Leo XIV is pushing the Catholic Church to act on climate
item.description: Pope Leo XIV convened a conference dedicated to deepening the environmental advocacy of the Catholic Church, with a little help from Arnold Schwarzenegger. Claire Giangravé with Religion News Service reports from Italy
item.content:encoded: Pope Leo XIV convened a conference dedicated to deepening the environmental advocacy of the Catholic Church, with a little help from Arnold Schwarzenegger. Claire Giangravé with Religion News Service reports from Italy
item.dc:creator: Andrew Limbong

item.title: Does One Battle After Another actually meet the moment?
item.description: NPR's Bob Mondello and Marc Rivers join host Andrew Limbong to talk about Paul Thomas Anderson's new film and other films that reflect the politics and tensions of our time.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Bob Mondello and Marc Rivers join host Andrew Limbong to talk about Paul Thomas Anderson's new film and other films that reflect the politics and tensions of our time.
item.dc:creator: Bob Mondello

item.title: How one doctor endured Rwanda's Marburg outbreak and helped turn the tide
item.description: Dr. Tsion Firew, an emergency physician in Kigali, recalls the terrifying early days of Rwanda's Marburg outbreak and how she helped launch a response that changed its course.
item.content:encoded: Dr. Tsion Firew, an emergency physician in Kigali, recalls the terrifying early days of Rwanda's Marburg outbreak and how she helped launch a response that changed its course.
item.dc:creator: Gabrielle Emanuel

item.title: The album Cate Le Bon never planned to write was born of heartbreak
item.description: Welsh artist Cate Le Bon has been reluctant to write about love in the past but embraces the heartache and challenges of breakup on her new album Michelangelo Dying.
item.content:encoded: Welsh artist Cate Le Bon has been reluctant to write about love in the past but embraces the heartache and challenges of breakup on her new album Michelangelo Dying.
item.dc:creator: Jeffrey Pierre

item.title: Reporting on federal workers as the federal workforce is reshaped
item.description: Federal workers across the United States are feeling the impact of the government shutdown. This comes after months of turmoil for federal workers as agencies have slashed their workforces as part of the Trump administration's large-scale government job cuts.
item.content:encoded: Federal workers across the United States are feeling the impact of the government shutdown. This comes after months of turmoil for federal workers as agencies have slashed their workforces as part of the Trump administration's large-scale government job cuts.
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hsu

item.title: As talks move forward, Trump's Gaza plan sparks both hope and uncertainty
item.description: Israelis and Palestinians share cautious reactions to President Trump's plan to end the war, as talks move forward and airstrikes continue.
item.content:encoded: Israelis and Palestinians share cautious reactions to President Trump's plan to end the war, as talks move forward and airstrikes continue.
item.dc:creator: Carrie Kahn

item.title: What's driving President Trump's new confidence in Ukraine's war effort
item.description: The president's bold statement surprised allies and raised new questions about whether U.S. policy toward the war is changing.
item.content:encoded: The president's bold statement surprised allies and raised new questions about whether U.S. policy toward the war is changing.
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordoñez
